horse.name: Horse
horse.description: The Horse symbolizes energy, freedom, and an adventurous spirit. People born in the Year of the Horse are known for their enthusiasm, independence, and love of freedom. They are warm-hearted, optimistic, and always ready for new challenges.

culture.title: About Chinese New Year
culture.intro: Chinese New Year, also known as the Spring Festival, is the most important traditional holiday in Chinese culture. It marks the beginning of a new year on the lunar calendar and is celebrated with family reunions, festive meals, and vibrant traditions.
culture.heritage: Inheriting thousand-year culture, celebrating Spring Festival together

items.name: Family Reunion Dinner

items.name: Red Envelopes (Hongbao)

items.name: Fireworks & Firecrackers
items.description: Loud celebrations to ward off evil spirits and welcome good fortune.

items.name: Spring Cleaning
items.description: Sweeping away bad luck before the new year to make room for good fortune.
